alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 8:52AM MDT until April 20 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River At Ashton affecting Spink County. James River near Stratford affecting Brown and Spink Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Ashton. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect some crop land along with moderate flooding of pasture and low-lying areas At 14.0 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the bridge 3 miles north and 1 1/2 mile east of Ashton * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 13.2 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 13.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon to 11.6 feet early Tuesday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 600 PM CDT.
